title: Weird behaviour with selection on Android

labels.name: Platform: Android
labels.description: Android applications.

body:
## Description
After reseting the selection on a text input, the input keep reseting the selection to the value, which makes the cursor flickering as the user types something. This happens only on android, on iOS it works fine

Similar issue: https://github.com/facebook/react-native/issues/26047

## React Native version:
System:
    OS: macOS 10.15
    CPU: (4) x64 Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-7360U CPU @ 2.30GHz
    Memory: 47.43 MB / 8.00 GB
    Shell: 5.7.1 - /bin/zsh
  Binaries:

    Yarn: 1.22.4 - /usr/local/bin/yarn

    Android SDK:
      API Levels: 23, 24, 25, 26, 27, 28
      Build Tools: 23.0.1, 25.0.2, 26.0.1, 26.0.2, 27.0.3, 28.0.3, 29.0.2
      System Images: android-23 | Intel x86 Atom_64, android-23 | Google APIs Intel x86 Atom_64, android-27 | Google Play Intel x86 Atom
      Android NDK: Not Found
  IDEs:
    Android Studio: 3.6 3.6
    Xcode: 11.3.1/11C504 - /usr/bin/xcodebuild
  Languages:

    Python: 2.7.16 - /usr/bin/python

    react: 16.9.0 => 16.9.0 
    react-native: 0.62.2 => 0.62.2 
  npmGlobalPackages:
    *react-native*: Not Found

## Steps To Reproduce

1. Type something on the input
2. Click the button
3. Try to type something again on the input

## Expected Results
The cursor should behave normally

title: Refactor RNTester

labels.name: CLA Signed
labels.description: This label is managed by the Facebook bot. Authors need to sign the CLA before a PR can be reviewed.

body:
## Summary

This PR tries to remove the code duplication between `RNTesterApp.ios.js` and `RNTesterApp.android.js`. The common code has been moved to `RNTesterAppShared.js`. 

This PR also refactors the state architecture and simplifies it to use just one single `useReducer` hook to manage the app's state.

It also adds the visibility hack to make the screen change a little bit faster and removed the unneeded test files.

title: [Android] overscroll issue for ScrollView with nestedScrollEnabled nested inside "inverted" FlatList

labels.name: Platform: Android
labels.description: Android applications.

body:
## Description
When nesting a ScrollView with the property `nestedScrollEnabled={true}` inside a FlatList that has the property `inverted={true}`, overscrolling the ScrollView makes the FlatList scroll in the opposite direction of where it is supposed to scroll.

[Illustrative video full res](https://github.com/OlivierFreyssinet/RNNestedScrollViewInvertedIssue/blob/master/docs/fullvid.mp4)

### Expected behaviour (happens in a non inverted FlatList)
FlatList not inverted: When the nested ScrollView is scrolled past its edges (overscroll), the FlatList scrolls in the correct direction
![gif of expected behaviour (not displayed for some reason)](http://github.com/OlivierFreyssinet/RNNestedScrollViewInvertedIssue/blob/master/docs/expected.gif)

### Buggy behaviour (happens in an inverted FlatList)
Flatlist inverted: When the nested ScrollView is scrolled past its edges (overscroll), the FlatList scrolls in the wrong direction
![gif of buggy behaviour](https://github.com/OlivierFreyssinet/RNNestedScrollViewInvertedIssue/blob/master/docs/expected.gif)


## React Native version:
```
System:
    OS: macOS Mojave 10.14.5
    CPU: (8) x64 Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-8569U CPU @ 2.80GHz
    Memory: 280.58 MB / 16.00 GB

    Android SDK:
      API Levels: 23, 27, 28, 29
```

title: [androidTV] Scrollview still scrollable with dpad when scrollEnabled={false}

labels.name: Platform: Android
labels.description: Android applications.

body:
## Description
A scrollview with the `scrollEnabled` prop set to `false` still scrolls on tv remote dpad input on androidTV.
Also onScroll events are fired when the list is scrolled this way.

## React Native version:
0.61.5

## Expected Results
The scrollview should not scroll when `scrollEnabled` is set to false, regardless of touch, mouse or dpad input.

title: Start using Jest's "modern" fake-timer implementation.

labels.name: Needs: Environment Info
labels.description: Please run `react-native info` and edit your issue with that command's output.

body:
Recent improvements have been made to Jest's implementation of fake timers, on an opt-in basis, with a plan to make them the default in the future: https://github.com/facebook/jest/pull/7776.

Some prep work has been done toward this (https://github.com/facebook/react-native/pull/29011), but I don't find an existing issue for the actual change.

Simply flipping the switch to the "modern" implementation gives several test failures, likely due to some combination of 

- dependency on wrong semantics of the legacy implementation, and
- https://github.com/facebook/jest/issues/10221

I'm excited for `facebook/react-native`'s own tests to be made more correct, but I particularly hope to draw attention to the fact that React Native apps can't currently use the new implementation (https://github.com/facebook/jest/issues/10221, https://github.com/facebook/react-native/issues/29303, https://github.com/facebook/react-native/pull/29754). This is a problem for apps that can't use the legacy implementation either, because of its issues (not having `Date.now()` faked is a big one).

title: after loading error Image does not show defaultSource and does not respect style

labels.name: Needs: Repro
labels.description: This issue could be improved with a clear list of steps to reproduce the issue.

body:
## Description
I want to use [Image](https://reactnative.dev/docs/image.html) to display a remote PNG. Therefore I setup the URL in the `source` prop. Before the image is ready to be displayed I want to show a placeholder image. I used the `defaultSource` to a local asset/image.

## React Native version:
0.63.2

## Steps To Reproduce / Expected Results

#### basic setup:
`<Image source=... defaultSource=... />`
local = require('....image.png')
remote = { uri: ... }

#### cases:

source=local
-> ok, shows local image

source=remote
-> ok, shows local image

defaultSource=local
source=malformed remote
-> I expect to see the local image but there is nothing.
Additionally, I setup a border in `style` but also this border is not shown.
onError is called as expected.

### and the docs:

Also it is not clear to me what is the difference between the following props, because both talk about "loading"

`defaultSource`
A static image to display while loading the image source.

`loadingIndicatorSource`
...displayed until image is ready to be displayed, typically after when it got downloaded from network.


## Snack, code example, screenshot, or link to a repository:
N/A

title: Change default PixelRatio.getFontScale scale to 1

labels.name: CLA Signed
labels.description: This label is managed by the Facebook bot. Authors need to sign the CLA before a PR can be reviewed.

body:
## Summary

In my testing, doing `intendedfontsize * PixelRatio.getFontScale()` is how this is intended to be used.

It doesn't make sense to me to default the font scale to the device pixel ratio. In practice, that means font sizes will be scaled different depending on pixel density, which doesn't make sense (the "scale" of fonts should be consistent independent of pixel ratio). I'm surprised this hasn't come up before, but I think it's because in practice a font scale is always set.

Currently I'm unable to handle a "default" font scale, because there's no way to distinguish it defaulting to pixel density vs a user setting their font scale to the same value.

## Changelog

<!-- Help reviewers and the release process by writing your own changelog entry. For an example, see:
https://github.com/facebook/react-native/wiki/Changelog
-->

[General] [Fixed] - Default PixelRatio.getFontScale() to 1

## Test Plan

<!-- Demonstrate the code is solid. Example: The exact commands you ran and their output, screenshots / videos if the pull request changes the user interface. -->

Let me know if there's anything aside from CI I should provide.

title: PlatformColor does not work properly on Android

labels.name: Needs: Repro
labels.description: This issue could be improved with a clear list of steps to reproduce the issue.

labels.name: Platform: Android
labels.description: Android applications.

body:

`PlatformColor` documentation clearly says that if I want to use the values of `R.attr` in Android, I have to use `?attr/VALUE`, but when I use for example `?attr/textColorPrimary`, the app crashes on Android or throws an error.

https://developer.android.com/reference/android/R.attr#textColorPrimary

title: Modal crashes while pressing on Text input
body:
Hello.I have a modal and there is a text input inside the modal.When i am pressing the textinput keyboard opens and in next second both keyboard and modal closes.

## Description
Hello.I have a modal and there is a text input inside the modal.When i am pressing the textinput keyboard opens and in next second both keyboard and modal closes.


## React Native version:
{
  "main": "node_modules/expo/AppEntry.js",
  "scripts": {
    "start": "expo start",
    "android": "expo start --android",
    "ios": "expo start --ios",
    "web": "expo start --web",
    "eject": "expo eject"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@react-native-community/masked-view": "0.1.10",
    "@react-navigation/drawer": "^5.9.0",
    "@react-navigation/native": "^5.7.3",
    "@react-navigation/stack": "^5.9.0",
    "expo": "~38.0.8",
    "expo-status-bar": "^1.0.2",
    "react": "~16.11.0",
    "react-dom": "~16.11.0",
    "react-native": "https://github.com/expo/react-native/archive/sdk-38.0.2.tar.gz",
    "react-native-elements": "^2.1.0",
    "react-native-gesture-handler": "~1.6.0",
    "react-native-reanimated": "~1.9.0",
    "react-native-safe-area-context": "~3.0.7",
    "react-native-screens": "~2.9.0",
    "react-native-web": "~0.11.7",
    "react-redux": "^7.2.1",
    "react-thunk": "^1.0.0",
    "redux": "^4.0.5",
    "redux-thunk": "^2.3.0"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/core": "^7.8.6",
    "babel-preset-expo": "~8.1.0"
  },
  "private": true
}


## Steps To Reproduce
Provide a detailed list of steps that reproduce the issue.

const [modalVisible, setModalVisible] = useState(false);
  
<View>
        <Icon
            name="pencil"
            type="font-awesome"
            color="white"
            onPress={() => {
              setModalVisible(!modalVisible);
            }}
          />
        <Modal
        animationType={"slide"}
        transparent={false}
        visible={modalVisible}
      
      >
            
              <TextInput
                placeholder="write your name"
                              />
                             
       <Button
            onPress={() => setModalVisible(false)}
            title="Learn More"
            color="#841584"
          />
      </Modal>
        </View>

## Expected Results
When we press on TextInput keyboard opens and modal and keyboard closes.

title: Border width differing between iOS and Android

labels.name: Platform: Android
labels.description: Android applications.

labels.name: Platform: iOS
labels.description: iOS applications.

body:
## Description
When adding a bottom/left border with a radius, the width and radius seem to be completely different on Android vs iOS.

iOS
![iOS](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/59912aeec5b4f676bbeb64c4ed2f2f74040f3ea6/68747470733a2f2f692e696d6775722e636f6d2f513036547332482e706e67)

Android
![android](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/0f59c9b9ad00441b62f57cb0eff18fbbb30590cd/68747470733a2f2f692e696d6775722e636f6d2f566e34706731382e706e67)

The top view has the same width and radius as the bottom and matches on android/ios, however, when you remove the top border or top left radius as in the bottom view they look completely different.

## React Native version:
Expo CLI 3.24.2 environment info:
System:
OS: Windows 10 10.0.18363
Binaries:
Node: 12.13.1 - C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.EXE
npm: 6.9.0 - C:\Program Files\nodejs\npm.CMD
npmPackages:
expo: ~38.0.8 => 38.0.8
react: ~16.11.0 => 16.11.0
react-dom: ~16.11.0 => 16.11.0
react-native: https://github.com/expo/react-native/archive/sdk-38.0.2.tar.gz => 0.62.2

## Steps To Reproduce

1. Create a component with a bottom left radius, left border width and bottom border width.

## Expected Results
The border width and radius should match between android and iOS

## Snack, code example, screenshot, or link to a repository:
Use this code to reproduce the images from above, or use this [snack](https://snack.expo.io/@campbellmg/border-issue)

```javascript
export default class App extends React.Component {
  render() {
    return (
      <View style={styles.container}>
      <View style={styles.semicircle}/>
      <View style={styles.corner}/>
      </View>
    );
  }
}

const styles = StyleSheet.create({
  container: {
    flex: 1,
    justifyContent: 'center',
    alignItems: 'center',
    paddingTop: Constants.statusBarHeight,
    backgroundColor: '#ecf0f1',
    padding: 8,
  },
    semicircle: {
    borderBottomLeftRadius: 100,
    borderTopLeftRadius: 100,
    borderLeftWidth: 10,
    borderBottomWidth: 10,
    borderTopWidth: 10,
    height: 50,
    width: 50,
    borderColor: 'red'
  },
  corner: {
    borderBottomLeftRadius: 100,
    borderLeftWidth: 10,
    borderBottomWidth: 10,
    height: 50,
    width: 50,
    borderColor: 'red'
  },
});
```

title: EXIF stripped from images sent in POST requests
body:
## Description
This is a pretty bizarre issue and is a bit tricky to reproduce but essentially EXIF is being stripped from images when sent over a POST request after navigation. 

This issue could be rooted in `react-native`, `react-navigation` or `Expo` but I am having a hard time tracking down which so if you have any information I would be very grateful.

## React Native version:
  Expo CLI 3.24.2 environment info:
    System:
      OS: Windows 10 10.0.18363
    Binaries:
      Node: 12.13.1 - C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.EXE
      npm: 6.9.0 - C:\Program Files\nodejs\npm.CMD
    npmPackages:
      expo: ~38.0.8 => 38.0.8
      react: ~16.11.0 => 16.11.0
      react-dom: ~16.11.0 => 16.11.0
      react-native: https://github.com/expo/react-native/archive/sdk-38.0.2.tar.gz => 0.62.2

### Snack, code example, screenshot, or link to a repository:
This [repo](https://github.com/CampbellMG/expo-exif) contains the bare minimum code to reproduce this issue. 

The server directory includes an express server that will send the photo or receive a photo and extract the exif.

The client directory includes the Expo app which simply retrieves the file from the server and sends it back. The process is duplicated over two screens. 

To set up the environment: 

1. Update your local address in `client/ImageProcessor.ts`
2. Start the server with: `cd server && npm start`
3. Start the Expo app with: `cd client && npm start`
4. Open the app in the Expo client

<!--
- This should include as little code as possible, please don't simply link your entire project
- Sharing a link to a [Snack](https://snack.expo.io/) is a GREAT way to provide a reproducible demo :) 
- If a reproducible demo, or a complete list of steps from blank project to bug, are not provided, it is very likely your issue will be closed
- If you need more guidance, please see https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve
-->
<!--
As an added benefit- creating a repro may help you identify the source of the bug, which means we are one step closer to fixing it! Thanks for helping us help you!
-->
 
### Steps to Reproduce
1. In the app, click `Retrieve image`
2. Click `Send Image`
  You should now see the photo and its extracted EXIF in the server's `uploads` directory
  You can repeat this step as many times as you like to prove that the issue does not simply occur on the second attempt
3. Press navigate to move to the next screen
4. Press send 
  You can check the code but this performs exactly the same action as step 5 just from another screen
  If you now look at the extracted EXIF in the server's `uploads` directory you will see all the non-default values are missing
5. Go back to the first screen
6. Press send again
 Even though we are performing the same action as step 5 any photos now uploaded will not contain the attached EXIF

## Expected Results

![Exif Comparison](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40409896/91118463-5fa00800-e6d4-11ea-9623-11130fb77544.PNG)

I would expect the extracted EXIF to match regardless of when or where the image was sent.

I know this is tedious to reproduce so I appreciate anyone that has made it this far. I am at a complete loss on how to proceed from here so please let me know if there is any more information I can provide or anything I can assist with.

title: Jest setup: Stop polyfilling Promise.

labels.name: No CLA
labels.description: Authors need to sign the CLA before a PR can be reviewed.

body:
Hi! 👋 I hope anyone reading this is doing OK these days. Thanks, in any case, for continuing to put your time into the awesome React Native ecosystem.

## Summary

It looks like this line was introduced in 3ff3987, in 2015, and it
has remained in a similar form since then. I haven't found any
explanation for it.

At facebook/jest#10221 [1], a core Jest maintainer says,

"""
As an aside, one should never replace `global.Promise` [...]. E.g.
when using `async-await` you will always get the native `Promise`
regardless of the value of `global.Promise`.
"""

facebook/jest#10221 is one issue this line has raised, for anyone
using the latest features of Jest to test async code in their React
Native projects.

[1] https://github.com/facebook/jest/issues/10221#issuecomment-654687396

Fixes: #29303

## Changelog

[General] [Fixed] - Fix issue with testing async code with Jest's fake timers.

## Test Plan

It looks like there's still an effort to keep up-to-date with new versions of the `promise` NPM package; see https://github.com/facebook/react-native/commit/b23efc526446cad53adc3de7465fd8be7309d84e. But that commit still leaves it a mystery why we're polyfilling `Promise` here.

I also see [Libraries/Core/polyfillPromise.js](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/blob/master/Libraries/Core/polyfillPromise.js), but I haven't run into any problems that I can trace to that file.

It's hard to say what side effects might arise from removing the line without knowing what it's for. (https://github.com/facebook/react-native/issues/29303 exists mostly to ask that question.)

labels.name: CLA Signed

labels.name: Platform: Android
labels.description: Android applications.

body:
## Summary 

fixes https://github.com/facebook/react-native/issues/29747. <Button /> crashing the app for Android API 16. 
This PR is inteded to fix wrong  `TouchableNativeFeedback` `canUseNativeForeground` check.

`canUseNativeForeground` only available on Android API >= 23.
https://github.com/facebook/react-native/blob/6d175f2c257fe1acb1c36b15bc97bdb77560885c/ReactAndroid/src/main/java/com/facebook/react/views/view/ReactViewManager.java#L105-L111

## Changelog
[Android] [Fixed] - TouchableNativeFeedback canUseNativeForeground check.

## Test Plan
RNTester

title: Update TouchableNativeFeedback component

labels.name: CLA Signed
labels.description: This label is managed by the Facebook bot. Authors need to sign the CLA before a PR can be reviewed.

body:
Fixes https://github.com/MLH-Fellowship/react-native/issues/240

## Summary
The PR is part of an effort to update the code comments to match the current documentation on the React Native website. The project is a part of the MLH Fellowship program and involves the automatic generation of the website docs from code comments and flow types as the end result.

To learn more about the project you can visit the project wiki: 
- [Project Details](https://github.com/MLH-Fellowship/0.4.x-projects/wiki/React-Native-Flowtype-API-Docs-Generator)
- [RN Docs Standards](https://github.com/MLH-Fellowship/react-native/wiki/RN-Docs-standards)

Link to the documentation(the source of truth): 
- [touchablenativefeedback.md](https://github.com/MLH-Fellowship/react-native-website/blob/master/docs/touchablenativefeedback.md)

## Changes
* Update the title and prop description from docs.
* Remove unnecessary `*` from the code comments.
* Add Snack player example specified in the docs to the code comments as JSDoc.
* Add `@type` annotation to parse supported datatype by the prop.
* Add `@platform` annotation to specify platforms supported by a prop.
* Add `@default` annotation to parse default value of prop.

## Changelog
[Internal]

## Test Plan
All changes are made to the code comments and thus there is no need for testing.

Reviewed by @jevakallio

title: Upstream RN macOS Hermes integration bits

labels.name: CLA Signed
labels.description: This label is managed by the Facebook bot. Authors need to sign the CLA before a PR can be reviewed.

labels.name: Type: Enhancement
labels.description: A new feature or enhancement of an existing feature.

labels.name: p: Microsoft
labels.description: Partner: Microsoft

body: ## Summary Microsoft’s RN for macOS fork supports the Hermes engine nowadays https://github.com/microsoft/react-native-macos/pull/473. As a longer term work item, we’ve started moving bits that are not invasive for iOS but _are_ a maintenance burden on us—mostly when merging—upstream. Seeing as this one is a recent addition, it seemed like a good candidate to start with. As to the actual changes, these include: * Sharing Android’s Hermes executor with the objc side of the codebase. * Adding a CocoaPods subspec to build the Hermes inspector source and its dependencies (`Folly/Futures`, `libevent`). * Adding the bits to the Xcode build phase script that creates the JS bundle for release builds to compile Hermes bytecode and source-maps… * …coincidentally it turns out that the Xcode build phase script did _not_ by default output source-maps for iOS, which is now fixed too. All of the Hermes bits are automatically enabled, on macOS, when providing the `hermes-engine-darwin` [npm package](https://www.npmjs.com/package/hermes-engine-darwin) and enabling the Hermes pods. ## Changelog [General] [Added] - Upstream RN macOS Hermes integration bits ## Test Plan Building RNTester for iOS and Android still works as before. To test the actual changes themselves, you’ll have to use the macOS target in RNTester in the macOS fork, or create a new application from `master`:

labels.description: iOS applications.

body:
Fix a issue that RCTModalHostView can't be dismissed while being presented

## Summary

Steps To Reproduce
A native modal presented view controller is being dismissed before the first screen shows.
A RCTModalHostView is presented when the first screen shows.
The RCTModalHostView will be dismissed after an asynchronous callback.
If the callback was called before the completion of the presenting animation, the RCTModalHostView will not be dismissed.

## Changelog

[iOS] [Fixed] - Fix that RCTModalHostView can't be dismissed while being presented

## Test Plan

body:
Thank you for creating a great framework.
My English is not good, so please take it into consideration.

## Description
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42797995/91022229-d505cd00-e62f-11ea-824e-a58796170f77.png)

### When a new scroll starts, the momentum that started before does not stop.
Next is my problem scenario.
OverScrolling(up) in ScrollView and scrolling down immediately(a short delay), I was able to get unwanted results.
The screenshot is outputting the results of onScroll events.
"-188" is overScrolling(up). After that, I immediately scrolled down (onTouchStart).
After "+99" I took off my hand and started my momentum, but as you can see from the screen shot.
The momentum started in overScrolling(up) was not deleted, such as "-18, -11, -5, -1.5, 0, 0".

The difference between positive and negative values is large, causing bug in my app.
![2020-08-24 17-20-06 2020-08-24 17_23_32](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42797995/91025802-d38ad380-e634-11ea-91bd-91323199acb6.gif)


## React Native version:
System:
    OS: macOS 10.15.5
    CPU: (8) x64 Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-8257U CPU @ 1.40GHz
    Memory: 192.63 MB / 16.00 GB
    Shell: 5.7.1 - /bin/zsh

    Watchman: 4.9.0 - /usr/local/bin/watchman
  Managers:
    CocoaPods: 1.9.1 - /usr/local/bin/pod
  SDKs:
    iOS SDK:
      Platforms: iOS 13.6, DriverKit 19.0, macOS 10.15, tvOS 13.4, watchOS 6.2
    Android SDK: Not Found

    Android Studio: 3.6 AI-192.7142.36.36.6241897
    Xcode: 11.6/11E708 - /usr/bin/xcodebuild
  Languages:
    Java: javac 14 - /usr/bin/javac
    Python: 2.7.16 - /usr/bin/python
  npmPackages:
    @react-native-community/cli: Not Found
    react: 16.13.1 => 16.13.1
    react-native: 0.63.2 => 0.63.2
  npmGlobalPackages:
    *react-native*: Not Found

## Steps To Reproduce
Provide a detailed list of steps that reproduce the issue.

1. append ScrollView your App
2. overscrolling and immediately scrolling down
3. check your onScroll event's e.nativeEvent.contentOffset

## Expected Results
When scrolling, the momentum that was started before must be stopped.

## Snack, code example, screenshot, or link to a repository:

If it's not enough, I'll give an example.

Thank you.
